abstract: Steve Burke, who will become NBC Universal’s chief when Comcast completes its takeover, announced a much-anticipated management lineup.
snippet: Steve Burke, who will become NBC Universal’s chief when Comcast completes its takeover, announced a much-anticipated management lineup.
lead_paragraph: The incoming chief of NBC Universal announced a management lineup on Thursday that is a mix of old and new.

headline.main: Comcast Taps New Names, and Old, to Run NBC Universal

abstract: Brian L. Roberts, chairman and chief executive of Comcast, was honored at the Advertising Council’s annual fund-raising dinner last night.
snippet: Brian L. Roberts, chairman and chief executive of Comcast, was honored at the Advertising Council’s annual fund-raising dinner last night.
lead_paragraph: All did not go exactly according to plan at the Advertising Council’s annual fund-raising dinner on Wednesday night, which gave its joint masters of ceremonies, Jimmy Fallon and Brian Williams, more time to rib the dinner’s honoree and their soon-to-be boss, Brian L. Roberts, chairman and chief executive of Comcast.

headline.main: Brian Williams and Jimmy Fallon Team Up to Rib Future Boss

abstract: The central bank’s planned tests of the 19 biggest financial institutions are a good thing. What’s less so is the Fed’s plan to keep the results private.
snippet: The central bank’s planned tests of the 19 biggest financial institutions are a good thing. What’s less so is the Fed’s plan to keep the results private.
lead_paragraph: The newly powerful Federal Reserve may have missed a trick. The central bank, charged under the Dodd-Frank overhaul bill with broad oversight of the banking system, is asking the 19 biggest American financial institutions to submit to a series of stress tests. That’s a good thing. The trouble is the regulator plans to keep the results and the criteria used in the tests private.

headline.main: Fed’s Stress Tests Have Shortcoming in Disclosure

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

byline.original: By Rob Cox and Jeffrey Goldfarb
